body: This still seems to be an issue with relative submodules in subdirectories. Maybe the unit tests are not so correct. For example, ``` [submodule "rel1"] path = foo/bar/rel1 url = ../test ``` If the repository is `gitea.demo.com/org/repo` The above submodule is then mounted on path, `gitea.demo.com/org/repo/foo/bar/rel1 -> gitea.demo.com/org/test` but Gitea resolution seems to apply the relative url to the *path*, and not just the repository location. No matter where the submodule is moved to, the path changes, but the relative url remains as-is. The above example would then be resolved in Gitea as, `gitea.demo.com/org/repo/foo/bar/rel1 -> gitea.demo.com/org/repo/foo/test` Screenshot from my example running again main branch,

So, just to spell it out, by default, the *name* of the submodule is equal to its *path* when it's initially created. So,


Submodule created as `ok/here/too`

```
[submodule "ok/here/too"]
	path = ok/here/too
	url = ../test
```

Then I move it to `ok` as `ok/too`

```
[submodule "ok/here/too"]
	path = ok/too
	url = ../test
```

So,

```
[submodule "name"]
    path=mount_point
    url=repo_location
```

The `name` is arbitrary. It just has to be unique. The `path` is what's important locally and the `url` is relative to local repository and has nothing to do with submodule name or mount_point.
